adjectives.description: pantomimical (comparative more pantomimical, superlative most pantomimical)

entries.meaning: (now rare) Expressed or carried out using mime or mimicry. [from 17th c.]
examples: The old man, during this pantomimical conversation, in some degree recovered his spirits […].

entries.meaning: (now rare) Like or pertaining to a pantomime. [from 18th c.]
examples: By this pantomimical contrivance, and change of scene and character, the parts help each other out in matters which neither of them singly would assume to act.
